page.title: 04WORSBROUGH WOMEN
page.content: {Anne Scargill}and other Worsbrough women felt they had to help during the Miners' Strike in 1984-85. Eight weeks into the strike they, with the Barnsley Group, organized a{National {Womens' Rally}and 14,000 came. They provided food for women from the Kent, Scottish and Yorkshire Areas. The women marched from Churchfield to the Civic Hall where there were speakers. After that they picketed alongside the miners and on the third picket 14 Barnsley (and Worsbrough) women were arrested. In June they began serving{food at the Welfare Hall for striking miners and their families. The strike changed their lives. Since it ended some have become very active in public affairs. They have spoken before large audiences in this country and abroad, and have appeared on television.
